userreviews.userReview: Fun, especially at the start, but descends into dullness about halfway and never really recovers.A disappointing example of Milligan's otherwise brilliant humour.

Just finished reading this - have to say, not as good as his other 'according to' books. Still, there were some laugh aloud bits that made me look like an idiot in the eyes of the people aroud me!My favourite joke?"And the eyes of them were both opened and they knew they were both naked, and Adam said to her, 'stand back, I don't kow how big this is going to get.' "Well, that got a huge snort of laughter!Silly, funny and something to dip in and out of whenever you're in the mood. Great.

I had high hopes for this book which I thought would be hilarious. However after a few pages I was bored but I can't leave a book unfinished so I ploughed on and the only way I could finish it was to read another book alongside it to break up the monotony and finally skim-reading the last 40 pages. Not the late Spike's finest work I'm afraid.

Not as long as the original, but not as many laughs either. I'm a big Milligan fan, but this is unremitting tedium. What might have been funny as a 2 page parody, is wearisome as a 180 page book. Not going to seek out his version of the New Testament.

This is a book that I pick up every few years when I want a serious laugh. even after all the times I have read it can still make my eyes water before I howl and roll around on the ground. testament to an immortal comedy genius

Irreverent, witty and at the same time quite profound in a humorous way. Spike's humour is just infectious and if you know your Bible you will be chuckling throughout the book. You need to have a degree of familiarity with the Bible to appreciate fully the humour - loved it

Possibly one of the funniest books I have read.I do believe I have amassed approximately a total of 150 odd dollars, in library late fees purely from this book. - it's just too good to take back.Should have just kept it the first time and paid the $60 for a replacement.
“And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, and the earth brought forth grass and the Rastafarians smoked it.”
I enjoyed this book it made me laugh would read more by Spike
An excellent read, using many of Spike's turns of phrase. A must for any Goon fan.
I thought this was going to be amazing, but after the first couple of pages the comedy diminished, and I felt it was very patchy.
Great book, just love his sense of humor.
I laughed all the way through this book and then started over and read it again.

title:
